{{about|the date|the American holiday|Independence Day (United States)}}
{{pp-move-indef}}{{calendar}}
{{This date in recent years}}
{{Day}} The [[Aphelion]], the point in the year when the Earth is farthest from the Sun, occurs around this date.

==Events==
*[[362 BC]] &ndash; [[Battle of Mantinea (362 BC)|Battle of Mantinea]]: The [[Thebes, Greece|Thebans]], led by [[Epaminondas]], defeated the [[Sparta]]ns. 
* [[414]] &ndash; Emperor [[Theodosius II]], age 13, yields power to his older sister [[Pulcheria|Aelia Pulcheria]], who reigned as [[regent]] and proclaimed herself empress (''[[Augusta (honorific)|Augusta]]'') of the [[Byzantine Empire|Eastern Roman Empire]].
* [[836]] &ndash; ''[[Pactum Sicardi]]'', a peace treaty between the [[Duchy of Benevento|Principality of Benevento]] and the [[Duchy of Naples]], is signed.
* [[993]] &ndash; [[Ulrich of Augsburg]] is [[Canonization|canonized]] as a saint.
*[[1054]] &ndash; A [[SN 1054|supernova]] is seen by [[Song Dynasty|Chinese]], [[Arab]] and possibly [[Indigenous Peoples of the Americas|Amerindian]] observers near the [[star]] Zeta [[Taurus (constellation)|Tauri]]. For several months it remains bright enough to be seen during the day. Its remnants form the [[Crab Nebula]].
*[[1120]] &ndash; [[Jordan II of Capua]] is anointed as prince after his infant nephew's death.
*[[1187]] &ndash; [[Crusades|The Crusades]]: [[Battle of Hattin]] &ndash; [[Saladin]] defeats [[Guy of Lusignan]], [[Kings of Jerusalem|King of Jerusalem]].
*[[1253]] &ndash; Battle of West-Capelle: [[John I of Avesnes]] defeats [[Guy of Dampierre]].
*[[1359]] &ndash; [[Francesco II Ordelaffi]] of [[Forlì]] surrenders to the Papal commander [[Gil Álvarez Carrillo de Albornoz|Gil de Albornoz]].
*[[1456]] &ndash; [[Ottoman wars in Europe]]: The [[Siege of Belgrade (1456)|Siege of Nándorfeqhérvár (Belgrade)]] begins.
*[[1534]] &ndash; [[Election of Christian III|Christian III is elected King of Denmark and Norway]] in the town of [[Old Rye|Rye]].
*[[1569]] &ndash; The King of Poland and the Grand Duke of Lithuania, [[Sigismund II Augustus]], signes the [[Union of Lublin|document of union between]] Poland and Lithuania, creating a new state called the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]].
*[[1610]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Klushino]] is fought between forces of the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]] and [[Tsardom of Russia|Russia]] during the [[Polish-Muscovite War (1605-1618)|Polish-Muscovite War]].
*[[1634]] &ndash; The city of [[Trois-Rivières]] is founded in [[New France]] (now Quebec, Canada)
*[[1744]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Lancaster]], in which the [[Iroquois]] cedes lands between the [[Allegheny Mountains]] and the [[Ohio River]] to the British colonies, was signed in [[Lancaster, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1754]] &ndash; [[French and Indian War]]: [[George Washington]] surrenders [[Fort Necessity National Battlefield|Fort Necessity]] to French Capt. [[Louis Coulon de Villiers]].
*[[1774]] &ndash; [[Orangetown Resolutions]] are adopted in the [[Province of New York]], one of many protests against the [[Parliament of Great Britain|British Parliament's]] [[Coercive Acts]]
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: The [[United States Declaration of Independence]] is adopted by the [[Second Continental Congress]]. [[Image:Declaration independence.jpg|thumb|200px|The [[United States Declaration of Independence|United States]] declared its independence in 1776.]]
*[[1778]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: American forces under [[George Rogers Clark|George Clark]] capture [[Kaskaskia, Illinois|Kaskaskia]] during the [[Illinois campaign]].
*[[1802]] &ndash; At [[West Point, New York]], the [[United States Military Academy]] opens.
*[[1803]] &ndash; The [[Louisiana Purchase]] is announced to the American people.
*[[1817]] &ndash; In [[Rome, New York]], construction on the [[Erie Canal]] begins.
*[[1826]] &ndash; [[Thomas Jefferson]], third president of the United States, dies the same day as [[John Adams]], second president of the United States, on the fiftieth anniversary of the adoption of the [[United States Declaration of Independence]].
*[[1827]] &ndash; [[Slavery]] is abolished in [[New York|New York State]].
*[[1831]] &ndash; [[Samuel Francis Smith]] writes [[My Country, 'Tis of Thee]] for the Boston, MA July 4th festivities.
*[[1837]] &ndash; [[Grand Junction Railway]], the world's first long-distance [[railway]], opens between [[Birmingham]] and [[Liverpool]].
*[[1838]] &ndash; The [[Iowa Territory]] is organized.
*[[1855]] &ndash; In [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City]], the first edition of [[Walt Whitman]]'s book of [[poem]]s, ''[[Leaves of Grass]]'', is published.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Lewis Carroll]] tells [[Alice Liddell]] a story that would grow into ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]'' and its sequels.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Siege of Vicksburg]] &ndash; [[Vicksburg, Mississippi]] surrenders to [[Ulysses S. Grant]] after 47 days of siege. 150 miles up the Mississippi River, a Confederate Army was repulsed at the [[Battle of Helena]], Arkansas.
*  1863   &ndash; American Civil War: The [[Army of Northern Virginia]] [[Battle of Gettsyburg#Confederate retreat|withdrew from the battlefield]] after losing the [[Battle of Gettysburg]], signalling an end to the [[Confederate States of America|Southern]] [[Gettysburg Campaign|invasion]] of the [[Northern United States|North]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]]'' is published.
*[[1878]] &ndash; Thoroughbred horses [[Ten Broeck]] and [[Mollie McCarty]] run a [[Ten Broeck - Mollie McCarty match race|match race]], recalled in the song [[Molly and Tenbrooks]].
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Anglo-Zulu War]]: the Zululand capital of [[Ulundi]] is captured by British troops and burned to the ground, ending the war and forcing King [[Cetshwayo]] to flee.
*[[1881]] &ndash; In [[Alabama]], the [[Tuskegee Institute]] opens.
*[[1886]] &ndash; The people of France offer the [[Statue of Liberty]] to the people of the United States.
*  1886   &ndash; The first scheduled Canadian transcontinental train arrives in [[Port Moody]], [[British Columbia]].
*[[1887]] &ndash; The founder of [[Pakistan]], [[Jinnah|Quaid-i-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah]], joins [[Sindh-Madrasa-tul-Islam]], [[Karachi]].
*[[1892]] &ndash; [[Western Samoa]] changes the [[International Date Line]], so that year it had 367 days, with two occurrences of Monday, July 4.
*[[1894]] &ndash; The short-lived [[Republic of Hawaii]] is proclaimed by [[Sanford B. Dole]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Philippine–American War]] officially is concluded.
*  1903   &ndash; [[Dorothy Levitt]] is reported as the first woman in the world to compete in a 'motor race'.
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[African-American]] boxer [[Jack Johnson (boxer)|Jack Johnson]] knocks out white boxer [[James J. Jeffries|Jim Jeffries]] in a heavyweight [[boxing]] match, sparking [[race riot]]s across the United States.
*[[1911]] &ndash; A [[1911 Eastern North America heat wave|massive heat wave]] strikes the northeastern United States, killing 380 people in eleven days and breaking temperature records in several cities.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Woodrow Wilson]] addresses [[American Civil War]] veterans at the [[Great Reunion of 1913]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; The funeral of [[Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria|Archduke Franz Ferdinand]] and his wife [[Sophie, Duchess of Hohenberg|Sophie]] takes place in [[Vienna]], six days after their assassinations in [[Sarajevo]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Ottoman sultan]] [[Mehmed VI]] ascended to the throne.
*  1918   &ndash; [[World War I]]: the [[Battle of Hamel]], a successful attack by the [[Australian Corps]] against German positions near the town of [[Le Hamel, Somme|Le Hamel]] on the [[Western Front (World War I)|Western Front]].
*  1918   &ndash; [[Bolshevik]]s killed Tsar [[Nicholas II of Russia]] and his family ([[Julian calendar]] date).
*  1926   &ndash; [[Knoebels Amusement Resort]] is opened in [[Elysburg, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; The [[Lockheed Vega]] first flew.
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[Leo Szilard]] patented the chain-reaction design for the [[atomic bomb]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Lou Gehrig]], recently diagnosed with [[Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis]], informs a crowd at [[Yankee Stadium (1923)|Yankee Stadium]] that he considered himself "The luckiest man on the face of the earth", then announces his retirement from major league [[baseball]].
*  1939   &ndash; [[Huỳnh Phú Sổ]] founds [[Hòa Hảo|Hòa Hảo Buddhism]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[Nazi Germany|Nazi]] troops [[Massacre of Lwów professors|massacre Polish scientists and writers]] in the captured [[Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic|Ukrainian]] city of [[Lviv]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Kursk]], the largest full-scale battle in history and the world's largest tank battle, begins in [[Prokhorovka]] village.
*  1943   &ndash; World War II: In [[Gibraltar]], a [[Royal Air Force]] [[Consolidated B-24 Liberator|B-24 Liberator]] bomber [[1943 Gibraltar B-24 crash|crashes]] into the sea in an apparent accident moments after takeoff, killing sixteen passengers on board; only the pilot survives.
*[[1946]] &ndash; After 381 years of near-continuous colonial rule by various powers, the [[Philippines]] attains full independence from the United States.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The "Indian Independence Bill" is presented before the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|British House of Commons]], proposing the independence of the [[Presidencies and provinces of British India|Provinces of British India]] into two sovereign countries: India and [[Pakistan]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Radio Free Europe]] first broadcasts.
*[[1951]] &ndash; A court in [[Czechoslovak Socialist Republic|Czechoslovakia]] sentences American journalist [[William N. Oatis]] to ten years in prison on charges of espionage.
*  1951   &ndash; [[William Shockley]] announced the invention of the [[Bipolar junction transistor|junction transistor]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; Due to the post-Independence Day admission of Hawaii as the 50th [[U.S. state]] on [[August 21]], 1959, the 50-star [[flag of the United States]] debuts in [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]], almost ten and a half months later (see Flag Act).
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] signs the [[Freedom of Information Act (United States)|Freedom of Information Act]] into [[United States law]]. The act went into effect the next year.
*[[1969]] &ndash; The [[Zodiac Killer]] attacks two teens (one male, one female) at [[Blue Rock Springs]] in [[California]]; they were his second known victims.  The female died.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli commandos]] [[Operation Entebbe|raid Entebbe]] airport in [[Uganda]], rescuing all but four of the passengers and crew of an [[Air France]] jetliner seized by Palestinian terrorists.
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[George Jackson Brigade]] plants a bomb at the main power substation for the [[Washington (state)|Washington]] state capitol in [[Olympia, Washington|Olympia]], in solidarity with a prison strike at the [[Walla Walla State Penitentiary]] Intensive Security Unit
*[[1982]] &ndash; Four [[Iran|Iranian]] diplomats [[Iranian diplomats kidnapping (1982)|are abducted]] by Lebanese militia in [[Lebanon]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; In France, former [[Gestapo]] chief [[Klaus Barbie]] (aka the "Butcher of Lyon") is convicted of [[crimes against humanity]] and sentenced to life imprisonment.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Sumitomo Group|Sumitomo Chemical]]'s resin plant in [[Niihama, Ehime|Nihama]] explodes, killing one worker and injuring three others.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[NASA]]'s [[Mars Pathfinder|Pathfinder]] space probe lands on the surface of [[Mars]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Japan]] launches the [[Nozomi (spacecraft)|Nozomi]] probe to [[Mars]], joining the [[United States]] and [[Russia]] as a [[outer space|space]] exploring nation.
*[[2004]] &ndash; The cornerstone of the [[One World Trade Center|Freedom Tower]] is laid on the site of the [[World Trade Center]] in New York City.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Deep Impact (spacecraft)|Deep Impact]] collider hits the [[comet]] [[Tempel 1]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; The [[Statue of Liberty]]'s crown reopens to the public after eight years of closure due to security concerns following the [[September 11 attacks]].
*  2009   &ndash; The first of [[July 2009 Mindanao bombings|four days of bombings]] begins on the southern [[Philippines|Philippine]] island group of [[Mindanao]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; The discovery of particles consistent with the [[Higgs boson]] at the [[Large Hadron Collider]] is announced at [[CERN]].
